00003 /* includes for general purpose callback tasks          */

00038 #ifndef INCcallbackh
00039 #define INCcallbackh 1
00040 
00041 /*
00042  * WINDOWS also has a "CALLBACK" type def
00043  */
00044 #ifdef _WIN32
00045 #       ifdef CALLBACK
00046 #               undef CALLBACK
00047 #       endif /*CALLBACK*/
00048 #endif /*_WIN32*/
00049 #define NUM_CALLBACK_PRIORITIES 3
00050 #define priorityLow     0
00051 #define priorityMedium  1
00052 #define priorityHigh    2
00053     typedef struct callbackPvt {
00054 #ifdef __STDC__
00055    void (*callback) (struct callbackPvt *);
00056 #else
00057    void (*callback) ();
00058 #endif
00059    int priority;
00060    void *user;                  /*for use by callback user */
00061 } CALLBACK;
00062 
00063 #ifdef __STDC__
00064 typedef void (*CALLBACKFUNC) (struct callbackPvt *);
00065 #else
00066 typedef void (*CALLBACKFUNC) ();
00067 #endif
00068 
00069 #define callbackSetCallback(PFUN,PCALLBACK)\
00070 ( (PCALLBACK)->callback = (PFUN) )
00071 #define callbackSetPriority(PRIORITY,PCALLBACK)\
00072 ( (PCALLBACK)->priority = (PRIORITY) )
00073 #define callbackSetUser(USER,PCALLBACK)\
00074 ( (PCALLBACK)->user = (VOID *)(USER) )
00075 #define callbackGetUser(USER,PCALLBACK)\
00076 ( (USER) = (void *)((CALLBACK *)(PCALLBACK))->user )
00077 
00078 #ifdef __STDC__
00079 long callbackInit();
00080 void callbackRequest(CALLBACK *);
00081 void callbackRequestProcessCallback(CALLBACK * pCallback, int Priority, void *pRec);
00082 int callbackSetQueueSize(int size);
00083 #else
00084 long callbackInit();
00085 void callbackRequest();
00086 void callbackRequestProcessCallback();
00087 int callbackSetQueueSize();
00088 #endif /*__STDC__*/
00089 
00090 
00091 #endif                          /*INCcallbackh */
